case_vignette: A 35-year-old construction worker presents with a well-circumscribed, verrucous plaque on his left upper arm! The lesion has been present for a few months, but recently has increased in size and become painful! He reports that a cough preceded his skin lesion, but otherwise has no relevant medical history! A large verrucous and ulcerating lesion with pustules is seen! On palpation, a purulent discharge is expressed!
question: What is the final diagnosis?

Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a rough, raised skin patch on my left upper arm that has grown in size, become painful and started releasing pus when touched.
Has the skin patch changed in color or bled at any time?
No, it has not changed in color or bled.
Do you have any known allergies or medical conditions?
No, I don't have any known allergies or medical conditions.
Have you had any similar skin issues in the past?
No, I haven't had similar skin issues in the past.
How long have you had this skin patch and has it always been painful?
The skin patch has been present for a few months, but it only recently became painful.
Have you used any new skincare products, detergents, or been exposed to any new materials or environments recently?
No, I have not used any new skincare products, detergents, or been exposed to any new materials or environments recently.
Is there a history of skin cancer or any other skin-related issues in your family?
No, there is no history of skin cancer or other skin-related issues in my family.
Final Diagnosis: Cutaneous abscess
